quotes.quote: The Irish people are clearly standing up and saying of course the lives of women in Ireland matter. It's a great victory for equality for freedom for dignity for human rights, -- and not only for women.
The Irish consider retirement the time to kick back and enjoy life to the fullest.
Only Irish coffee provides in a single glass all four essential food groups: alcohol, caffeine, sugar and fat.
It is a symbol of Irish art. The cracked looking-glass of a servant.
The Irish are people who will never have leaders, for at the great moment they always desert them. They have produced one skeleton--Parnell--never a man.
The Irish - Be they kings, or poets, or farmers, They're a people of great worth, They keep company with the angels, And bring a bit of heaven here to earth.
Irishness is not primarily a question of birth or blood or language; it is the condition of being involved in the Irish situation, and usually of being mauled by it.
The Irish are a fair people: They never speak well of one another.
Irish poets, learn your trade, sing whatever is well made, scorn the sort now growing up all out of shape from toe to top.
Irish people are educated not only about artistry but local history.
If it was raining soup, the Irish would go out with forks.
The Irish fight amongst themselves because they have yet to find a more worthy opponent.
On the Irish ladder of success there's always some one on the rung above using your head to steady himself.
Irish people have a trick of over-statement, at which one ceases to wince as one grows older.
To be Irish is to know that in the end the world will break your heart.
The only way to get to that next peak is to be ready for that next valley. Being raised Irish, you know to always be ready for the bad times.
The Irish people will only be free, when they own everything from the plough to the stars.
Irish people give big hellos and very little goodbyes. Unless they're female, and then they spend five hours talking in the doorway to the person that's leaving their house.
Irish people are pragmatic. They understand that nobody is going to fix our problems but ourselves.
The Irish do not want anyone to wish them well; they want everyone to wish their enemies ill.
Irish women are always carrying water on their heads, and always carrying their husbands home from pubs. Such things are the greatest posture-builders in the world.
There are only two kinds of people in the world, the Irish and those who wish they were.
There is no language like the Irish for soothing and quieting.
There's no sense to being Irish unless you know the world's going to break your heart.
The Irish have a sweet tooth. And that's a good thing, because it has been the inspiration for some wonderful desserts that allow us to end our meal on a happy and sweet note.
There is an Irish way of paying compliments as though they were irresistible truths which makes what would otherwise be an impertinence delightful.
If you're Irish, it doesn't matter where you go - you'll find family.
The Irish are the only men who know how to cry for the dirty polluted blood of all the world.
